definitions.definition: Defective and impossible to materially correct or set aright .
examples: The construction flaw is incorrigible ; any attempt to amend it would cause a complete collapse.

definitions.definition: Unmanageable ; impervious to correction by punishment or pain .

examples: His dark soul was too incorrigible to repent, even at his execution.

definitions.definition: Unchangeably established in a belief or habit .
Intrinsically incapable of being corrected; impossible to disprove , by its very nature.
examples: The statement "My knee hurts" is incorrigible .
definitions.label_groups: philosophy , of a proposition or belief

main_definition: Defective and impossible to materially correct or set aright .
secondary_definitions: Unmanageable ; impervious to correction by punishment or pain .
Unchangeably established in a belief or habit .
( philosophy , of a proposition or belief ) Intrinsically incapable of being corrected; impossible to disprove , by its very nature.
( archaic , of a disease ) Impossible to cure .
